platforms.name: Brave Search
platforms.about: Brave Search is a privacy-preserving search engine developed by Brave Software, offering independent search results without tracking users or their queries.

platforms.name: Google
platforms.about: Google Search is the most widely used search engine worldwide, offering a vast index of web pages and various search functionalities, including images, news, and maps.

platforms.name: Bing
platforms.about: Bing is a web search engine owned and operated by Microsoft. It offers various search services, including web, image, video, and map search, and integrates with Microsoft products.

platforms.name: Yahoo!
platforms.about: Yahoo! Search is a web search engine provided by Yahoo. It also serves as a comprehensive web portal offering news, email, and other online services.

platforms.name: DuckDuckGo
platforms.about: DuckDuckGo is a search engine that emphasizes protecting searchers' privacy. It does not track users or filter search results based on past activity.

platforms.name: Baidu
platforms.about: Baidu is a Chinese multinational technology company specializing in Internet-related services and products, primarily known for its dominant search engine in China.

platforms.name: Yandex
platforms.about: Yandex is a Russian multinational technology company providing Internet-related products and services, including its widely used search engine, often considered the 'Google of Russia.'

platforms.name: Ecosia
platforms.about: Ecosia is a search engine that donates 80% or more of its profits to non-profit organizations focused on reforestation. Users contribute to planting trees by searching online.

platforms.name: Ask.com
platforms.about: Ask.com, formerly Ask Jeeves, is a question-answering focused web search engine. It allows users to ask questions in natural language and provides answers and related search results.

platforms.name: Qwant
platforms.about: Qwant is a French search engine that prides itself on not tracking its users and providing unbiased results. It aims to offer an alternative to major search engines with a focus on privacy.

platforms.name: WolframAlpha
platforms.about: WolframAlpha is a computational knowledge engine that answers factual queries directly by computing the answer from structured data, rather than providing a list of documents or web pages.

platforms.name: Google Visual Search
platforms.description: Search with an image on Google
platforms.about: Google's visual search allows you to search using an image instead of text, helping you find similar images, products, and information related to the image.

platforms.name: Bing Visual Search
platforms.description: Search with an image on Bing
platforms.about: Bing's visual search lets you explore the web by using an image. You can find similar images, identify objects, and get more information about what's in your picture.

platforms.name: Facebook
platforms.about: Facebook is a social media and social networking service owned by Meta Platforms. It allows users to create profiles, share photos and videos, send messages, and join groups.

platforms.name: Instagram
platforms.about: Instagram is a photo and video sharing social networking service owned by Meta Platforms. Users can share visual content, apply filters, and interact with others' posts.

platforms.name: X - Twitter
platforms.about: Twitter (now X) is a microblogging and social networking service where users post and interact with messages known as 'tweets.' It's a platform for real-time news and conversations.

platforms.name: LinkedIn
platforms.about: LinkedIn is a business and employment-focused social media platform that operates via websites and mobile apps. It's primarily used for professional networking, including job seeking and professional development.

platforms.name: Snapchat
platforms.about: Snapchat is a multimedia messaging app known for its ephemeral messages (snaps) that disappear after a short time. It also features stories, filters, and augmented reality lenses.

platforms.name: Reddit
platforms.about: Reddit is a social news aggregation, web content rating, and discussion website. Users submit content, which is then voted up or down by other members, influencing its visibility.

platforms.name: Tumblr
platforms.about: Tumblr is a microblogging and social networking website that allows users to post multimedia and other content to a short-form blog. Users can follow other blogs and reblog content.

platforms.name: TikTok
platforms.about: TikTok is a short-form video hosting service owned by ByteDance. It hosts a wide variety of short user-generated videos, from dance challenges to comedy sketches.

platforms.name: WeChat
platforms.about: WeChat is a Chinese multi-purpose messaging, social media, and mobile payment app developed by Tencent. It's a super-app offering various functions beyond messaging.

platforms.name: WhatsApp
platforms.about: WhatsApp is a free, cross-platform, encrypted messaging and voice over IP service owned by Meta Platforms. It allows users to send text and voice messages, make calls, and share media.

platforms.name: Line
platforms.about: Line is a free communication app for instant messaging, voice, and video calls. Popular in Asia, it also offers social networking features, games, and news feeds.

platforms.name: YouTube
platforms.about: YouTube is an American online video sharing and social media platform owned by Google. It hosts a vast array of user-generated and corporate media videos, including music videos, documentaries, and vlogs.

platforms.name: Vimeo
platforms.about: Vimeo is a video hosting, sharing, and services platform. It focuses on high-quality video content and offers tools for creators, professionals, and businesses.

platforms.name: Dailymotion
platforms.about: Dailymotion is a French video-sharing technology platform owned by Vivendi. It allows users to upload, watch, and share videos globally.

platforms.name: Netflix
platforms.about: Netflix is a global streaming service offering a vast library of films and television series, including award-winning Netflix Originals, across various genres and languages.

platforms.name: Hulu
platforms.about: Hulu is an American streaming service primarily focused on TV shows from major broadcast networks, as well as a growing library of original content and movies.

platforms.name: HBO Max
platforms.about: HBO Max (now Max) is a streaming service that combines all of HBO with an even broader collection of movies, series, and Max Originals from Warner Bros., DC, and more.

platforms.name: Disney+
platforms.about: Disney+ is a subscription streaming service from The Walt Disney Company. It features content from Disney's main entertainment studios, including Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, and National Geographic.

platforms.name: Amazon Prime Video
platforms.about: Amazon Prime Video is a subscription video on-demand service offered by Amazon. It provides a wide range of movies, TV shows, and Amazon Originals, often included with an Amazon Prime membership.

platforms.name: Apple TV+
platforms.about: Apple TV+ is a streaming service featuring Apple Originals—award-winning series, compelling dramas, groundbreaking documentaries, kids' entertainment, comedies, and more.

platforms.name: Paramount+
platforms.about: Paramount+ is a streaming service from Paramount Global, offering content from CBS, BET, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon, Paramount Pictures, and Showtime.

platforms.name: Peacock
platforms.about: Peacock is an American over-the-top video streaming service owned by NBCUniversal. It offers a variety of content, including TV shows, movies, news, and sports.

platforms.name: Crunchyroll
platforms.about: Crunchyroll is an American subscription video on-demand streaming service owned by Sony. It specializes in distributing and licensing anime, manga, and dorama.

platforms.name: Tubi
platforms.about: Tubi is a free, ad-supported video streaming service owned by Fox Corporation. It offers a large library of movies and TV shows from various studios.

platforms.name: Twitch
platforms.about: Twitch is an American live video streaming service owned by Amazon. It primarily focuses on video game live streaming, including esports competitions, as well as music broadcasts and creative content.

platforms.name: Spotify
platforms.about: Spotify is a Swedish audio streaming and media services provider. It offers digital copyright restricted recorded music and podcasts, including over 100 million songs and 5 million podcasts.

platforms.name: Apple Music
platforms.about: Apple Music is a music and video streaming service developed by Apple Inc. Users can stream over 100 million songs, listen to live radio, and watch music videos.

platforms.name: Amazon Music
platforms.about: Amazon Music is a music streaming platform and online music store operated by Amazon. It offers various tiers of service, including a free ad-supported version and premium subscriptions with unlimited access.

platforms.name: YouTube Music
platforms.about: YouTube Music is a music streaming service developed by YouTube. It provides a tailored interface for music streaming, allowing users to browse songs and music videos on YouTube based on genres, playlists, and recommendations.

platforms.name: Deezer
platforms.about: Deezer is a French online music streaming service. It allows users to listen to music online or offline on various devices and features a vast catalog of songs and podcasts.

platforms.name: SoundCloud
platforms.about: SoundCloud is a Swedish-founded online audio distribution platform and music sharing website. It enables its users to upload, promote, and share audio, as well as a digital signal processor.

platforms.name: Tidal
platforms.about: Tidal is a subscription-based music, podcast, and video streaming service that offers high-fidelity sound quality, high-definition music videos, and exclusive content.

platforms.name: Pandora
platforms.about: Pandora Radio is a music streaming and automated music recommendation service operated by Sirius XM Satellite Radio. It creates personalized radio stations based on user preferences.

platforms.name: iHeartRadio
platforms.about: iHeartRadio is an American online radio platform owned by iHeartMedia. It offers a wide variety of live radio stations, podcasts, and digital music streaming.

platforms.name: Bandcamp
platforms.about: Bandcamp is an online music store and a community for independent artists. It allows artists to set their own prices for digital and physical music and provides a platform for fans to directly support them.

platforms.name: Pinterest
platforms.about: Pinterest is a visual discovery engine for finding ideas like recipes, home and style inspiration, and more. Users can save and organize images and videos onto virtual 'boards.'

platforms.name: Google Images
platforms.about: Google Images is a search engine by Google that allows users to find images from across the web. It provides visual search results for keywords, enabling users to discover, view, and download images for personal or educational use.

platforms.name: Bing Images
platforms.about: Bing Images is a visual search engine by Microsoft that allows users to discover, view, and download images from across the web. It provides image search results for keywords, enabling users to explore a wide variety of visual content.

platforms.name: Brave Images
platforms.about: Brave Images is a privacy-focused image search feature from Brave Search, providing independent visual results without tracking users or their queries. It emphasizes user privacy while helping you discover images across the web.

platforms.name: Pexels
platforms.about: Pexels provides high-quality and completely free stock photos and videos contributed by talented creators. Ideal for websites, social media, and creative projects.

platforms.name: Unsplash
platforms.about: Unsplash offers a curated collection of high-resolution photos gifted by the world’s most generous community of photographers. Free to use for any purpose.

platforms.name: Pixabay
platforms.about: Pixabay is a massive resource of free stock photos, vector graphics, illustrations, videos, and music, all released under a simplified Pixabay license.

platforms.name: Kaboompics
platforms.about: Kaboompics offers stylish, high-resolution lifestyle photos with cohesive color palettes. Perfect for blog, social, and commercial design use.

platforms.name: Reshot
platforms.about: Reshot provides unique, non-stocky free images from emerging photographers. All photos are free for commercial use with no attribution required.

platforms.name: Life of Pix
platforms.about: Life of Pix offers free high-resolution photos donated by photographers. Focused on mood, creativity, and artistic quality, with new images added weekly.

platforms.name: LibreShot
platforms.about: LibreShot is a collection of original photos by Martin Vorel, offered under a free license for personal or commercial use. No attribution required.

platforms.name: DeviantArt
platforms.about: DeviantArt is a large social network for artists and art lovers. It includes digital art, photography, and fan art, though not all content is free for commercial use.

platforms.name: Wikipedia
platforms.about: Wikipedia is a multilingual, web-based, free-content encyclopedia project supported by the Wikimedia Foundation. It is written and maintained by a community of volunteers around the world.

platforms.name: Britannica
platforms.about: Encyclopædia Britannica is a general knowledge English-language encyclopedia. It is known for its authority and comprehensive coverage across various subjects.

platforms.name: Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy
platforms.about: The Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy is a dynamic encyclopedia of philosophy maintained by Stanford University. It is widely regarded as a comprehensive and authoritative resource in the field.

platforms.name: Encyclopedia.com
platforms.about: Encyclopedia.com provides access to nearly 200,000 reference entries from various trusted sources, including encyclopedias, dictionaries, and thesauruses.

platforms.name: Infoplease
platforms.about: Infoplease is a comprehensive reference source and a reliable resource for facts on a wide range of topics, combining an encyclopedia, dictionary, atlas, and almanac.

platforms.name: World History Encyclopedia
platforms.about: The World History Encyclopedia is a non-profit organization publishing free, reliable, and high-quality historical information online. It covers world history from prehistoric times to the present day.

platforms.name: Scholarpedia
platforms.about: Scholarpedia is an open-access online encyclopedia with peer-reviewed articles. Its articles are written by invited experts and are subject to a formal peer-review process, ensuring high quality and accuracy.

platforms.name: Simple Wikipedia
platforms.about: Simple English Wikipedia is an English-language edition of Wikipedia written primarily in Basic English and Simplified English. It is intended for people who are learning English or who find the regular Wikipedia too complex.

platforms.name: Citizendium
platforms.about: Citizendium is an English-language wiki-based online encyclopedia that aims to improve upon the Wikipedia model by requiring contributors to use their real names and by offering expert oversight.

platforms.name: ChatGPT
platforms.about: ChatGPT is a large language model chatbot developed by OpenAI. It is capable of generating human-like text responses, engaging in conversations, and performing various language-based tasks.

platforms.name: Copilot
platforms.about: Microsoft Copilot is an AI-powered assistant designed to enhance productivity and creativity across various Microsoft applications and services, integrating AI capabilities directly into workflows.

platforms.name: Perplexity AI
platforms.about: Perplexity AI is an AI-powered answer engine that provides direct answers to complex questions, citing its sources, similar to a conversational search engine.

platforms.name: Amazon
platforms.about: Amazon is an American multinational technology company focusing on e-commerce, cloud computing, online advertising, digital streaming, and artificial intelligence. It's the world's largest online marketplace.

platforms.name: eBay
platforms.about: eBay is an American multinational e-commerce company that facilitates consumer-to-consumer and business-to-consumer sales through its website. It's known for auctions and fixed-price listings.

platforms.name: Alibaba
platforms.about: Alibaba Group is a Chinese multinational technology company specializing in e-commerce, retail, Internet, and technology. It operates the world's largest B2B (business-to-business) online marketplace.

platforms.name: AliExpress
platforms.about: AliExpress is an online retail service based in China owned by Alibaba Group. It allows small businesses in China (and other locations) to sell products directly to international online buyers.

platforms.name: Walmart
platforms.about: Walmart is an American multinational retail corporation that operates a chain of hypermarkets, discount department stores, and grocery stores. Its online presence is a major e-commerce player.

platforms.name: Target
platforms.about: Target Corporation is an American big box department store chain. It offers a wide range of products including clothing, electronics, home goods, and groceries, both in-store and online.

platforms.name: Google Store
platforms.about: The Google Store is an online retail store operated by Google, selling Google-developed hardware products including Pixel phones, Google Nest devices, Fitbit wearables, and more.

platforms.name: Etsy
platforms.about: Etsy is an e-commerce website focused on handmade or vintage items and craft supplies. It connects buyers with independent sellers, offering unique and personalized products.

platforms.name: Best Buy
platforms.about: Best Buy is an American multinational retailer of consumer electronics. It sells a wide range of products including computers, televisions, home appliances, and more, both in stores and online.

platforms.name: Rakuten
platforms.about: Rakuten is a Japanese electronic commerce and online retailing company. It operates Japan's largest e-commerce site, Rakuten Ichiba, and offers various services including financial tech and digital content.

platforms.name: Flipkart
platforms.about: Flipkart is an Indian e-commerce company, headquartered in Bengaluru, Karnataka, India. It's one of the largest online retailers in India, offering a wide range of products from electronics to fashion.

platforms.name: Newegg
platforms.about: Newegg Inc. is an online retailer of computer hardware and software. It is a major e-commerce platform for tech enthusiasts and gamers, offering components and full systems.

platforms.name: Mercari
platforms.about: Mercari is a Japanese e-commerce company that operates an online marketplace allowing users to buy and sell items directly from each other, similar to a digital flea market.

platforms.name: Shopify
platforms.about: Shopify is a leading e-commerce platform that allows individuals and businesses to create their own online stores. It provides tools for website building, marketing, payments, and shipping.

platforms.name: Apple
platforms.about: Apple Inc. is an American multinational technology company renowned for designing, developing, and selling consumer electronics, computer software, and online services. Its popular products include the iPhone, Mac, and Apple Watch.

platforms.name: Samsung
platforms.about: Samsung is a South Korean multinational manufacturing conglomerate. It produces a wide range of electronics, including smartphones, televisions, home appliances, and semiconductors.

platforms.name: Xiaomi
platforms.about: Xiaomi Corporation is a Chinese designer and manufacturer of consumer electronics and related software, home appliances, and household items. It's best known for its smartphones.

platforms.name: OnePlus
platforms.about: OnePlus is a Chinese smartphone manufacturer, operating under Oppo, that designs and develops mobile phones. It's known for its high-performance smartphones and a strong community following.

platforms.name: Oppo
platforms.about: Oppo is a Chinese consumer electronics and mobile communications company known for its smartphones, Blu-ray players, and other electronic devices. It is one of the top smartphone brands globally.

platforms.name: Vivo
platforms.about: Vivo is a Chinese technology company that designs and develops smartphones, smartphone accessories, software, and online services. It is a major player in the global smartphone market.

platforms.name: Microsoft
platforms.about: Microsoft Corporation is an American multinational technology corporation producing computer software, consumer electronics, personal computers, and related services. Its best-known software products are the Windows line of operating systems.

platforms.name: NVIDIA
platforms.about: NVIDIA Corporation is an American multinational technology company known for designing graphics processing units (GPUs) for the gaming and professional markets, as well as chipsets for mobile computing and automotive markets.

platforms.name: Intel
platforms.about: Intel Corporation is an American multinational corporation and technology company. It is the world's largest semiconductor chip manufacturer by revenue, best known for its x86 series of microprocessors.

platforms.name: IBM
platforms.about: IBM (International Business Machines Corporation) is an American multinational technology and consulting company. It manufactures and markets computer hardware, middleware, and software, and provides hosting and consulting services.

platforms.name: Dell
platforms.about: Dell Technologies Inc. is an American multinational technology company that develops, sells, repairs, and supports computers and related products and services. It is one of the world's largest technology corporations.

platforms.name: HP
platforms.about: HP Inc. is an American multinational information technology company known for developing and providing a wide variety of hardware components, as well as software and related services to consumers, small and medium-sized businesses, and large enterprises.

platforms.name: Sony
platforms.about: Sony Corporation is a Japanese multinational conglomerate corporation. It operates as one of the world's largest manufacturers of consumer and professional electronic products, the largest video game console company, and the largest music entertainment company.

platforms.name: Lenovo
platforms.about: Lenovo Group Limited is a Chinese multinational technology company specializing in designing, manufacturing, and marketing consumer electronics, personal computers, software, business solutions, and related services. It's the world's largest personal computer vendor.

platforms.name: Cisco
platforms.about: Cisco Systems, Inc. is an American multinational digital communications technology conglomerate corporation. Cisco develops, manufactures, and sells networking hardware, software, telecommunications equipment, and other high-technology services and products.

platforms.name: Oracle
platforms.about: Oracle Corporation is an American multinational computer technology company. The company sells database software and technology, cloud engineered systems, and enterprise software products, particularly its own brands of database management systems.

platforms.name: Canva
platforms.about: Canva is an online graphic design platform that allows users to create social media graphics, presentations, posters, documents, and other visual content with drag-and-drop features and professional templates.

platforms.name: Adobe
platforms.about: Adobe Inc. is an American multinational computer software company historically focused upon the creation of multimedia and creativity software products. It's known for products like Photoshop, Illustrator, and Premiere Pro.

platforms.name: Figma
platforms.about: Figma is a web-based collaborative interface design tool. It allows multiple users to work on the same design project simultaneously, making it popular for UI/UX design and prototyping.

platforms.name: Behance
platforms.about: Behance is a social media platform owned by Adobe that allows creative professionals to showcase their portfolios of work. It serves as a community for discovering and being discovered by other creatives and potential clients.

platforms.name: Dribbble
platforms.about: Dribbble is a community and self-promotion platform for digital designers. It serves as a platform for designers to share small screenshots (shots) of their work, processes, and projects.

platforms.name: GitHub
platforms.about: GitHub is a web-based platform for version control and collaboration, primarily used for software development. It hosts source code, tracks changes, and facilitates collaboration among developers using Git.

platforms.name: Stack Overflow
platforms.about: Stack Overflow is a question and answer website for professional and enthusiast programmers. It's a key resource for developers to ask questions, share knowledge, and learn about programming.

platforms.name: GitLab
platforms.about: GitLab is a web-based DevOps lifecycle tool that provides a Git-repository manager with wiki, issue-tracking, and CI/CD pipeline features. It helps teams collaborate on software development from planning to deployment.

platforms.name: CodePen
platforms.about: CodePen is an online community for testing and showcasing user-created HTML, CSS, and JavaScript code snippets. It functions as a social development environment for front-end developers.

platforms.name: MDN Web Docs
platforms.about: MDN Web Docs (formerly Mozilla Developer Network) is a Mozilla project that provides documentation for web technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Web APIs. It's a comprehensive resource for web developers.

platforms.name: Google Workspace
platforms.about: Google Workspace (formerly G Suite) is a collection of cloud computing, productivity and collaboration tools, software and products developed by Google. It includes Gmail, Docs, Drive, Calendar, and Meet.

platforms.name: Microsoft 365
platforms.about: Microsoft 365 is a line of subscription services from Microsoft that offers a collection of productivity and collaboration tools, including Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), along with cloud services like OneDrive and Exchange.

platforms.name: Slack
platforms.about: Slack is a popular business communication platform that offers instant messaging, file sharing, and video conferencing. It's designed to streamline communication and collaboration within teams and organizations.

platforms.name: Zoom
platforms.about: Zoom is a popular cloud-based video conferencing service used for virtual meetings, webinars, and online collaboration. It allows users to connect remotely through video, audio, and chat.

platforms.name: Trello
platforms.about: Trello is a web-based, Kanban-style, list-making application that helps teams organize projects and tasks visually. It uses boards, lists, and cards to provide a clear overview of work progress.

platforms.name: Asana
platforms.about: Asana is a web and mobile application designed to help teams organize, track, and manage their work. It aims to improve team collaboration and project management efficiency.

platforms.name: BBC News
platforms.about: BBC News is an operational business division of the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) responsible for the gathering and broadcasting of news and current affairs. It is one of the largest news organizations in the world.

platforms.name: CNN
platforms.about: CNN (Cable News Network) is a multinational news channel headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, U.S. It was the first television channel to provide 24-hour news coverage and has a global presence.

platforms.name: The New York Times
platforms.about: The New York Times is an American daily newspaper based in New York City with a worldwide readership. It is a leading source of news and information, known for its in-depth reporting and analysis.

platforms.name: The Guardian
platforms.about: The Guardian is a British daily newspaper known for its progressive and liberal editorial stance. It provides extensive coverage of national and international news, politics, and culture.

platforms.name: Reuters
platforms.about: Reuters is an international news organization owned by Thomson Reuters. It provides news reports to newspapers, television and radio stations, and online media outlets worldwide.

platforms.name: Coursera
platforms.about: Coursera is an American online learning platform offering massive open online courses (MOOCs), specializations, and degrees from universities and companies. It provides access to a wide range of subjects.

platforms.name: edX
platforms.about: edX is an American massive open online course (MOOC) provider created by Harvard and MIT. It hosts online university-level courses in a wide range of disciplines to a worldwide audience, many at no charge.

platforms.name: Khan Academy
platforms.about: Khan Academy is an American non-profit educational organization. It produces short lessons in the form of videos and exercises, covering a wide range of academic subjects for learners of all ages.

platforms.name: Udemy
platforms.about: Udemy is an online learning and teaching marketplace with thousands of courses taught by expert instructors. It offers both free and paid courses across various subjects, from programming to photography.

platforms.name: Duolingo
platforms.about: Duolingo is an American educational technology company that produces a language-learning website and mobile app. It uses a gamified approach to help users learn new languages through short lessons.

platforms.name: Google Maps
platforms.about: Google Maps is a web mapping platform and consumer application offered by Google. It offers satellite imagery, aerial photography, street maps, 360° panoramic street views, real-time traffic conditions, and route planning.

platforms.name: Waze
platforms.about: Waze is a GPS navigation software app owned by Google. It uses real-time traffic information from users to optimize routes and provide alerts for hazards, police, and traffic jams.

platforms.name: Apple Maps
platforms.about: Apple Maps is a web mapping service developed by Apple Inc. for its iOS, iPadOS, macOS, and watchOS devices. It provides directions, points of interest, and detailed city guides.

platforms.name: PayPal
platforms.about: PayPal is an American multinational financial technology company operating an online payments system that supports online money transfers and serves as an electronic alternative to traditional paper methods like checks and money orders.

platforms.name: Visa
platforms.about: Visa Inc. is an American multinational financial services corporation. It facilitates electronic funds transfers throughout the world, most commonly through Visa-branded credit cards, debit cards, and prepaid cards.

platforms.name: Mastercard
platforms.about: Mastercard Inc. is an American multinational financial services corporation. It processes payments between banks of merchants and the card-issuing banks or credit unions of purchasers who use the 'Mastercard' brand debit, credit and prepaid cards.

platforms.name: American Express
platforms.about: American Express Company is a multinational financial services corporation best known for its credit card, charge card, and traveler's cheque businesses. It also offers travel-related products and services.

platforms.name: Chase
platforms.about: JPMorgan Chase & Co. is an American multinational financial services company. Chase Bank is its consumer and commercial banking business, offering various financial products and services, including banking, credit cards, and mortgages.

platforms.name: Booking.com
platforms.about: Booking.com is an online travel agency for lodging reservations. It offers booking services for hotels, apartments, villas, and other types of accommodation worldwide.

platforms.name: Airbnb
platforms.about: Airbnb is an online marketplace for lodging, primarily homestays for vacation rentals, and tourism activities. It allows individuals to rent out their properties or spare rooms to guests.

platforms.name: Expedia
platforms.about: Expedia Group is an American online travel shopping company for consumer and business travel. It operates various travel booking websites, including Expedia.com, Hotels.com, and Vrbo.

platforms.name: TripAdvisor
platforms.about: TripAdvisor is an American online travel company that provides hotel and restaurant reviews, accommodation bookings, and other travel-related content. It helps users plan and book their trips based on peer reviews.

platforms.name: Uber Eats
platforms.about: Uber Eats is an online food ordering and delivery platform launched by Uber. It allows users to order food from local restaurants and have it delivered to their location.

platforms.name: DoorDash
platforms.about: DoorDash is an American online food ordering and food delivery platform. It operates a logistics platform that connects customers with local restaurants and independent couriers.

platforms.name: Grubhub
platforms.about: Grubhub is an American online food ordering and delivery platform. It connects diners with local restaurants and offers takeout and delivery services.

platforms.name: Indeed
platforms.about: Indeed is an American worldwide employment website for job listings. It allows job seekers to search for jobs, upload resumes, and research companies, while employers can post jobs and find candidates.

platforms.name: Upwork
platforms.about: Upwork is a global freelancing platform where businesses and independent professionals connect and collaborate remotely. It allows clients to hire freelancers for various services like writing, design, and web development.

platforms.name: Fiverr
platforms.about: Fiverr is an online marketplace for freelance services. It's known for its 'gig' model, where freelancers offer services (gigs) starting from a few dollars, ranging from graphic design to digital marketing.

platforms.name: Google Drive
platforms.about: Google Drive is a file storage and synchronization service developed by Google. It allows users to store files in the cloud, synchronize files across devices, and share files with others.

platforms.name: Dropbox
platforms.about: Dropbox is a file hosting service that offers cloud storage, file synchronization, personal cloud, and client software. It enables users to store and share files securely across various devices.

platforms.name: OneDrive
platforms.about: OneDrive is a file hosting service and synchronization service operated by Microsoft as part of its web version of Office. It allows users to store files and personal data in the cloud, sync files across devices, and share them.

platforms.name: AWS (Amazon Web Services)
platforms.about: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a comprehensive, broadly adopted, and secure cloud platform offered by Amazon. It provides on-demand cloud computing platforms and APIs to individuals, companies, and governments.

platforms.name: Azure (Microsoft Azure)
platforms.about: Microsoft Azure, commonly referred to as Azure, is a cloud computing service operated by Microsoft. It provides a range of cloud services, including computing, analytics, storage, and networking, for building, deploying, and managing applications.

platforms.name: Google Cloud
platforms.about: Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is a suite of cloud computing services that runs on the same infrastructure that Google uses internally for its end-user products, such as Google Search and YouTube. It offers services for computing, storage, networking, and machine learning.
